p: In Figure 11, the black dots represent the two extra rows of atoms. The next row of atoms that follows the end of the dislocation rows shows a bright area where the position of the atoms is not well defined. The blue area that follows this row outlines a region where the light intensities indicate a cavity, area where there is not a discernible atomic structure. Figure 12a summarizes the preceding analysis; the yellow dots correspond to atoms that are under compression, the parameters a i are reduced. The region including green circles is under tension as shown in Figure 9a: parameters a i are increased. The region indicated as shear region corresponds to cases shown in Figure 7c,d.
